main event: A light purple object larger than a meteorite was observed breaking into three pieces and falling with a southerly heading at an elevation of 15,000-20,000 feet.
interesting points: The object was observed for approximately 1 minute.
The object entered the atmosphere at a 45-degree angle and the light went out as it broke into two pieces at an altitude of 12,022 feet.
The sighting was reported through a CIRVIS (Communications Instructions for Reporting Vital Intelligence Sightings) report.
The report indicates that the sighting could not be evaluated as a known type of meteorite.
Copies of the report were sent to various military and intelligence agencies, including the CIA.
sighted object: light purple object larger than a meteorite
